data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting any information when "Integrated Terminal"  is opened.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.Using "Ctrl+`" key open the Integrated Terminals.
3.Write down the command "node " with file name  and run the command.
4.Look at the output for the command

**Expected result:**
NVDA should recite when "Integrated Terminal" is opened and also recite for the output for the command that are executed.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not reciting when "Integrated Terminal" is opened and also not reciting the output for the executed command.

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know that Integrated Terminal is opened

**Attachments:**
![nvda_speechviewerinformation_vscodeeditor_terminalservices](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214304/d5ba2878-c2bf-11e6-9e31-2760b138386f.jpg)

data.title: "Open editors" can't be hidden when no folder is opened
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a new window without opening a folder
2. Set "explorer.openEditors.visible" to 0

Expected:
"Open editors" hidden in explorer.

Actual:
One open editor is shown (same as "explorer.openEditors.visible" being set to 1).

data.title: New seti icon theme looks bad
data.body:
Ever since the update to the seti icon theme, they are positioned very badly on Windows:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/21214296/051f523a-c29a-11e6-91b0-772aa5a5ccfb.png)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not announcing when "stepover","stepout","stepinto", are added to the code while debugging is on.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: Node.js and git repository need to be installed.
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.open any file and using "Ctrl+1" key  navigate to the  first vs code editor.
3.Adding a "breakpoint" to the line of code By pressing  "F9".
4.Start debugging by pressing "F5",key and observe NVDA behaviour.
5.Apply "stepover","stepout","stepinto" by pressing "F10","F11" and "shift+F11" ,key respectively.

**Expected result:**
NVDA should recite proper information when "stepover","stepout","stepinto",  are  added to the code while debugging is on.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not providing any information when "stepover","stepout","stepinto",  are  added to the code while debugging is on.

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know that "stepover","stepout","stepinto", are added to the code while debugging is on.

**Attachments:**
![nvda_speechviewerinformation_vscodeeditor_debuggingfeatures](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214226/56fee85c-c2bf-11e6-8e6d-4bb751cc7862.jpg)

data.title: Feature Request : Multiple windows when dragging files out of editor
data.body:
For instance when an editor tab is dragged out of the current vs code editor it will instantiate a new window for that file.

Thanks

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not announcing when "Debugging" is started by pressing "F5" key.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: Node.js and git repository need to be installed.
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.open any file and using "Ctrl+1" key  navigate to the  first vs code editor.
3.Adding a "breakpoint" to the line of code By pressing  "F9".
4.Start debugging by pressing "F5",key and observe NVDA behavior.

**Expected result:**
NVDA should recite like "Debugging started" when user press "F5" key  to start debugging.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not reciting anything when debugging started by pressing "F5" key.
Note:-The same issue is observed when debugging is "Paused" and "Stopped"
Note:-Inconsistent NVDA behavior is observed sometimes.

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know whether the Debugging is started or not as no announcement after "Debugging" has been started.

**Attachments:**
![nvda_speechviewerinformation_vscodeeditor_debugging](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21214116/c1e801e0-c2be-11e6-9e91-433dbe0c46e9.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not announcing when "Breakpoint" is added to the code.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: Node.js and git repository need to be installed.
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.open any file and using "Ctrl+1" key  navigate to the  first vs code editor.
3.Adding a "breakpoint" to the line of code By pressing  "F9" and observe the NVDA behavior.

**Expected result:**
NVDA should recite like "breakpoint added to the line of code n".

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not reciting any information when any breakpoint is added to the line of code.
Note:-Inconsistent NVDA behavior is observed sometimes.

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know whether the Breakpoint is added or not as no announcement after "Breakpoint" has been applied.

**Attachments:**
![nvda_speechviewerinformation_vscodeeditor_breakpoint](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21213999/f9e572e0-c2bd-11e6-9ab0-a2bef8777853.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting any information when "Rename Symbol" is applied to the any code for changing.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: Node.js and git repository need to be installed.
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.open any file and using "Ctrl+1" key  navigate to the  first vs code editor.
3.Select any code and press"F2" to rename the code.

**Expected result:**
NVDA should provide information when rename is done.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not announcing  when renaming is completed.

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know whether the symbol got Renamed or not as no announcement after "Rename Symbol" has been applied.

**Attachments:**
![nvda_speechviewerinformation_vscodeeditor_renamesymbol](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21213863/3332385e-c2bd-11e6-8996-d6cf4b7466cf.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting when "Format Code" is applied to the code.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: Node.js and git repository need to be installed.
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.open any file and using "Ctrl+1" key  navigate to the  first vs code editor.
3.Using "Alt+Shift+F", key apply "Format Code" to the existing code. 

**Expected result:**
NVDA should recite the information when "Format Code" is applied to the existing code.
EX:-If we apply by using "Alt+Shift+F" key then nvda should recite like "Format Code" is applied.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not announcing any information when format code is being applied.

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know whether the code got formatted or not as no announcement after "Format code" has been applied.

**Attachments:**

![nvda_speechviewerinformation_vscodeeditor_formatcode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21213775/b406e82c-c2bc-11e6-9a23-4f39ad3f8aac.jpg)

data.title: Arrow-up and down not working in "Find References" tree when NVDA is enabled
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: Node.js and git repository need to be installed.
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.Open any file and using "Ctrl+1" key  navigate to the  first vs code editor.
3.Select any code and using "Shift+F12", key apply "Find All References" to the code  present in the editor.

**Expected result:**
NVDA should recite all the available reference for the selected code.
EX:-When we apply "Shift+F12" for "Find All References" then NVDA should recite all the reference available to that particular code.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not announcing the available references for the selected code in the editor.

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know about results of find all references as it's not getting announced.

Attachments:
![nvda_speechviewerinformation_vscodeeditor_findallreference](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21213559/37a09996-c2bb-11e6-9c9d-abafedca835d.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting the when "Go to definition" and "Peek definition" is applied to the code.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: Node.js and git repository need to be installed.
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.open any file and using "Ctrl+1" key  navigate to the  first vs code editor.
3.Open one file navigate to some method and  use F12 to activate "Go to Definition" in the code for same method in the code.
4.Open one file navigate to some method in the code and  use ALT + F12 to activate "Peek Definition" to the code.

**Expected result:**
1.NVDA should announce when "go to definition " is open in a separate tab. 
2.NVDA should announce  the pop up window when "Peek Definition" is opened.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not reciting any proper information about the code when "Go to definition" and "Peek  Definition" are opened.

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know about the General Definition and Peek Definition of the Code 

**Attachments:**
![nvda_speechviewerinformation_vscodeeditor_codedefinition](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21213476/987c7a2e-c2ba-11e6-943a-0e958f5acc98.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting for the download notification in the https://code.visualstudio.com/Download link.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open the URL https://code.visualstudio.com/Download.
2.Download Visual studio code setup for Windows and save it.

**Expected result:**
NVDA should recite name of the download notification for the vs code editor installer in the https://code.visualstudio.com/Download.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not reciting the name of the download notification for the vs code editor installer in the  https://code.visualstudio.com/Download link

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know about the Notification appeared for Downloading VS Code Editor and They can't proceed further

**Attachments:**
![nvda_speechviewerinformation_vscodeeditor_downloadnotification](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21213396/0ef82244-c2ba-11e6-98b1-55af4bffcedf.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting the name for the options and extensions available in the extensions side bar area.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: Node.js and git repository need to be installed.
1.Open visual studio code.
2.Using "Ctrl+ Shift+ X", key navigate to the  "Extensions" side bar areas.
3.Using "Tab", key navigate to the "More", "Search fields" and available extensions present in the side bar areas.

Expected result:
NVDA should recite the name for the options "More", "Search fields" and available extensions present in the side bar areas.

Actual Result:
NVDA is not reciting anything for the options and extensions available in the sidebar area.
Note:-Inconsistent NVDA behavior is observed sometimes

User Impact:
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know the purpose of the control as it's not getting announced.

Attachments:
![inspectinformation_visualstudiocodeeditor_extensionsidebar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21213325/8ee5066c-c2b9-11e6-900d-a5249d3cee16.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting the name for the buttons  and files  available in the debug sidebar area.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: Node.js and git repository need to be installed.
1.Open visual studio code.
2.Using "Ctrl+Shift+D", key navigate to the Git button.
3.Using "Tab", key navigate to the "variables","watch","callstack" and "Breakpoint" section.

**Expected result:**
NVDA should recite the name for the buttons and files present in the "variables","watch","callstack" and "Breakpoint" section.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not reciting the name for the buttons and files present in the "variables","watch","callstack" and "Breakpoint" section.
**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know the purpose of the control as it's not getting announced

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting the name for the options in the "Git" side bar area.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: Node.js and git repository need to be installed.
1.Open visual studio code.
2.Using "Ctrl+ Shift+ G", key navigate to the Git button.
3.Using "Tab", key navigate to the "Commit all", "refresh", "more" and "Message box" option.
4.Using "Tab", key navigate to the files present in the "git" sidebar area.

**Expected result:**
1.NVDA should recite the name for the "Commit all", "refresh", "more" and "Message box" option.
2.NVDA should recite the files available in the git sidebar area.

Actual Result:
NVDA is not reciting anything for the options and files available in the sidebar area.

User Impact:
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know the purpose of the control as it's not getting announced

Attachments:
![inspectinformation_visualstudiocodeeditor_gitsidebararea](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21213127/799c5900-c2b8-11e6-8f62-d56899073d72.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting the entered code snippet to the program.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: Node.js and git repository need to be installed.
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.Using "ctrl+1" key navigate to the first editor.
3.Create an "index.html" file and type "!" + TAB key to create a code snippet with Emmet Syntax.

**Expected result:**
NVDA should recite the entire code snippet that was entered.
Ex:-If we enter the code snippet by typing "!"+TAB, key for html code then NVDA should recite html code  entered.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not reciting for the entered code snippet to the program.
Ex:-If we enter the code snippet by typing "!"+TAB, key for html code then NVDA is not reciting anything for the entered code to the program.

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know about the Code being added on Hitting "!+Tab" key

**Attachments:**
![nvda_speechviewerinformation_vscodeeditor_codesnippet](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21213046/ee80501a-c2b7-11e6-9996-0014b007aed9.jpg)

data.title: Usability: No intellisense narration by the NVDA screen reader for entering of any class to the editor.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: Node.js and git repository need to be installed.

1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.Open any file and navigate to the file in the editor.
3.Using keyboard create one class in the editor
Ex:-public class Accessibility
 {
  public string variable1 = "";
  public string prop1 {get;set;}
  public void Func1(){}
 }


**Expected result:**
NVDA should recite the suggestions  given by the vs editor as intellisense.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not reciting  the suggestions given by the editor as intellisense.
Note:-The same issue is observed for all the types of vs studio code Intellisense. 

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know available options under Intellisense and whether selected option is added or not

**Attachments:**
![nvda_speechviewer_intellisense](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21212969/5a150c7c-c2b7-11e6-9365-5e109c924589.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting the name for the added snippet into the program.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: Node.js and git repository need to be installed.
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.Open any file and press enter key to give some space.
3.Using "Ctrl+ Space" key open the suggestion and Type "For".
4.Using the Down arrow key select the "For loop " option.
5.Using keyboard select the value for the for loop section.

**Expected result:**
NVDA should recite the name for the added snippet into the code.
Ex:-If the user is adding "For loop" snippet into the program then NVDA should recite like "For Loop" suggestion and after entering then it should announce "For loop" added .

Actual Result:
NVDA is not reciting the name for the added snippet into the program.
Ex: If user enters "For" snippet to the program then NVDA is announcing like "for suggestion for(var index selected index)"

User Impact:
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know which code has been added as the Name of the code is not announced

Attachments:
![nvda_speechviewerinformation_vscodeeditor_snippet](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21212908/d6e63d58-c2b6-11e6-97ed-2bf4bc630681.jpg)

data.title: markdown preview - layout breaks on font zoom
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8 release
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open markdown (*.md) document in editor.
2. View markdown in preview mode.
3. Press Ctrl + "+" to zoom.

When previewing markdown documents in vscode, zooming the font causes the markdown window to shrink. The window gets visibly smaller with each zoom level.

![issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3048342/21212887/7cecc42c-c2f5-11e6-8d68-be76ec1ec4df.png)

Many Thanks

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not announcing the suggestions in the settings.json editor for change in user settings.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: Node.js and git repository need to be installed.
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.Open the command Pallet by pressing "F1" key and type "setting".
3.Using down-arrow key select user setting from the option and you will be redirected  to "settings.json"  editor.
4.Type the word "Auto " in the "settings.json"  editor.
 and select one of the suggestion given by the vs code editor.

**Expected result:**
NVDA should recite the suggestions correctly.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not announcing the suggestions in the settings. json editor.

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know the suggestions available as it's not getting announced.

**Attachments:**

![nvda_speechviewer_usersetting](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21212861/66303c3a-c2b6-11e6-8f21-4972a85ea7c1.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not announcing the name of the editor groups.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

Steps to Reproduce:
Prerequisite: NVDA need to be opened.
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.Using "Ctrl+1" key navigate to the left editor.
3.Using "Ctrl+2" key navigate to the side editor. 
4.Using "Ctrl+3",key navigate to the Right editor.

**Expected Result:**
NVDA should announce the name of the editor group  while navigating to 
Ex: NVDA should announce "app.js text editor 1" when the user is navigated to first editor.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not reciting the name for the editor groups while navigating to it.

User Impact:
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know the which Editor they are in and on pressing "Ctrl+1" they are navigated to the editor or not is not known.

![inspectinformation_visualstudiocodeeditor_editor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21212700/289d2b04-c2b5-11e6-9680-3f2e5cfd4bcb.jpg)

data.title: TypeScript intellisense does not work correctly for interface properties that can be an interface or an array of interfaces
VSCode not open after i upgraded to vscode 1.8.0
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8
- OS Version: OSX El Captian 10.11.4 (15E65)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Version 1.7 works, but after updating I stopped opening
2. If I reinstall 1.7 works perfectly, but I can not open it when I install 1.8
3. With version 1.7 deactivate all extensions and update to 1.8 but not open

data.title: Usability:ility: NVDA is not reciting the suggestions in the Command Palette edit box.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: NVDA need to be opened.

1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.Open the command Pallet by pressing "F1" key and type "Theme"
3.Using Down arrow key select "Preference color Theme" and press enter key to select.
4.Using "Up/Down" arrow key select different available theme.

**Expected Result:**
NVDA should recite the lookup options available for theme in the Command Palette edit box. 

**Actual Result:**
1. NVDA is not reciting the suggestions available in the Command Palette edit box.
Note:-This issue is observed for the all the options available in the command palette.

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know the options available in the command pallet and without knowing they can't proceed further.

![inspectinformation_vscodeeditor_quickpickeroption](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21212488/2a6ad596-c2b3-11e6-8a5e-4c5f101fbce8.jpg)

![nvda_speechviewerinformation_vscodeeditor_quickpickeroption](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21212497/324ee0e0-c2b3-11e6-82bc-fce2d97f030f.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA is not reciting the buttons and contents for "Explorer" view option.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: NVDA need to be opened.
1.Open visual studio code.
2.Using "Ctrl+ Shift+ E", key navigate to the Explorer button.
3.Using "Tab" ,key navigate to the side bar areas.

**Expected Result:**
NVDA should recite the buttons and contents present in the side bar areas for "Explorer" view bar option.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA is not reciting anything for the contents and buttons present in the side bar areas.

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know the purpose of the control as it's not getting announced.

![inspectinformation_visualstudiocodeeditor_sidebararea](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21212415/73ba7590-c2b2-11e6-8664-065375a94ef8.jpg)
![nvda_speechviewerinformation_vscodeeditor_sidebararea](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21212419/79c77064-c2b2-11e6-8c15-66dd21cd11e6.jpg)

data.title: Usability: NVDA  is not reciting the "Name" and "shortcut key " for the view bar buttons in the visual studio code editor.
data.body:
VS Code Version: 1.6.1
OS Version:1607
NVDA version:-2016.2.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Prerequisite: NVDA need to be opened.
1.Open visual studio code.
2.Using "Ctrl+ Shift+ E", key navigate to the Explorer button.
3.Using "Ctrl+ Shift+ F", key navigate to the Search button.
4.Using "Ctrl+ Shift+ G", key navigate to the Git button.
5.Using "Ctrl+ Shift+ D", key navigate to the Debug button.
6.Using "Ctrl+ Shift+ X", key navigate to the "Extension" button. 

**Expected Result:**
NVDA  should announce the name and the shortcut key for  the view bar buttons correctly.

**Actual Result:**
NVDA  is not announcing anything for  the view bar buttons present in the vs code editor.
Note: Same issue is observed to all the view bar buttons(Explorer, Search ,Git, Debug, Extension).

**User Impact:**
Screen Reader user doesn't get to know that the controls corresponds to which View bar.

![inspectinformation_visualstudiocodeeditor_search_viewbarbuttons](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21212343/b49cd180-c2b1-11e6-8291-2eb7ea0bf11d.jpg)

![nvda_speechviewerinformation_vscodeeditor_viewbaroption](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21212345/babad60c-c2b1-11e6-8e25-453b7ae3468d.jpg)
